ygData.subject: RE: [eqbards] Numbers on Bards
ygData.msgSnippet: My guess would be that the numbers for Enchanters, Wizards, Clerics, Druids and Shamen are greatly under-reported because of their tendency to go anon to avoid
ygData.messageBody:
My guess would be that the numbers for Enchanters, Wizards, Clerics, Druids
and Shamen are greatly under-reported because of their tendency to go anon
to avoid unwanted attention.

Twinks are in the habit of going anon too, so you can expect the Bard number
to be a bit higher since we're the current "vogue", twink-wise.

Bertoxx Bards are enjoying a bit of a renaissance - I typically see 18 in
the 40-60 range and 30 or more from 1-39.

Kyri

-----Original Message-----
From: Kimes, Dean W. [mailto:dean_kimes@...]
Sent: Tuesday, January 16, 2001 5:10 PM
To: 'eqbards@egroups.com'
Subject: [eqbards] Numbers on Bards


Well due to the enormous problems on E'ci getting numbers during peak time
has been difficult but here they are as it is.

Bards 31
Shadow Knights 49
Paladins 62.5
Rangers 48

Warriors 223
Rogues 43
Monks 39

Druids 196
Clerics 148
Shamans 143.5

Enchanters 128
Necromancers 124
Wizards 78.5
Magicians 116

Wizards are hugely underrepresented for an INT caster class and warriors are
by far the most common class on E'ci. How Anonymous affects these numbers
is undeterminable.

Kitasi
